autoChirp.webController

Class TweetController

  • java.lang.Object
    • autoChirp.webController.TweetController

  • @Controller
 @RequestMapping(value="/tweets")
public class TweetController
extends java.lang.Object
    A Spring MVC controller, responsible for serving /tweets. This controller implements the logic to manage and schedule Tweets from the web-UI. It loosely implements all CRUD methods and is strongly tied to all template-views. Every method uses the injected HttpSession object to check for an active user account. If no account is found in the session, the user is redirected to a genuin error/login page.
    Author:
    Philip Schildkamp

    • Method Detail

      • viewTweets

        @RequestMapping(value="/view")
public org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView viewTweets(@RequestParam(name="page",defaultValue="1")
                                                                                               int page)
        A HTTP GET request handler, responsible for serving /tweets/view. This method provides the returned view with all necessary Tweets from the database, chunking the results to support pagination.
        Parameters:
        page - Request param containing the page number, defaults to 1
        Returns:
        View containing the global Tweets overview

      • viewTweet

        @RequestMapping(value="/view/{tweetID}")
public org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView viewTweet(@PathVariable
                                                                                                        int tweetID)
        A HTTP GET request handler, responsible for serving /tweets/view/$tweetid. This method is called to view a single Tweet in detail. It reads all relevant information from the database and displays it as a view. If no Tweet with the requested ID is found, an error is displayed.
        Parameters:
        tweetID - Path param containing an ID-reference to a Tweet
        Returns:
        View containing details for one Tweet

      • addTweet

        @RequestMapping(value="/add")
public org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView addTweet()
        A HTTP GET request handler, responsible for serving /tweets/add. This method reads all groups from the database and feeds them to the view holding the form for Tweet-creation, thereby providing auto-completion for already created groups.
        Returns:
        View containing the Tweet-creation form

      • addTweetPost

        @RequestMapping(value="/add",
                method=POST)
public org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView addTweetPost(@RequestParam(value="tweetGroup")
                                                                                                                              java.lang.String tweetGroup,
                                                                                                                              @RequestParam(value="content")
                                                                                                                              java.lang.String content,
                                                                                                                              @RequestParam(value="tweetDate")
                                                                                                                              java.lang.String tweetDate,
                                                                                                                              @RequestParam(value="tweetTime")
                                                                                                                              java.lang.String tweetTime,
                                                                                                                              @RequestParam(value="imageUrl")
                                                                                                                              java.lang.String imageUrl,
                                                                                                                              @RequestParam(name="latitude",defaultValue="0.0")
                                                                                                                              float latitude,
                                                                                                                              @RequestParam(name="longitude",defaultValue="0.0")
                                                                                                                              float longitude)
        A HTTP POST request handler, responsible for serving /tweets/add. This method gets POSTed as the Tweet-creation form is submitted. All input- field values are passed as parameters and checked for validity. Upon success a new Tweet (possibly a new group, too) is added to the database. Because groups are referenced by ID but presented with their nicenames, a check for type-safety is employed to detect if the user wants the Tweet to be added to an existing (ID-referenced) or new (nicenamed) group.
        Parameters:
        tweetGroup - POST param bearing the referenced input-field value
        content - POST param bearing the referenced input-field value
        tweetDate - POST param bearing the referenced input-field value
        tweetTime - POST param bearing the referenced input-field value
        imageUrl - POST param bearing the referenced input-field value
        latitude - POST param bearing the referenced input-field value
        longitude - POST param bearing the referenced input-field value
        Returns:
        Redirect-view if successful, else error-view

      • addTweetToGroup

        @RequestMapping(value="/add/{groupID}")
public org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView addTweetToGroup(@PathVariable
                                                                                                             int groupID)
        A HTTP GET request handler, responsible for serving /tweets/add/$groupid. This method is responsible to present the Tweet-creation form with the group prefilled into the according input-field.
        Parameters:
        groupID - Path param containing an ID-reference to a group
        Returns:
        View containing the Tweet-creation form with prefilled group

      • addTweetToGroupPost

        @RequestMapping(value="/add/{groupID}",
                method=POST)
public org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView addTweetToGroupPost(@PathVariable
                                                                                                                                               int groupID,
                                                                                                                                               @RequestParam(value="content")
                                                                                                                                               java.lang.String content,
                                                                                                                                               @RequestParam(value="tweetDate")
                                                                                                                                               java.lang.String tweetDate,
                                                                                                                                               @RequestParam(value="tweetTime")
                                                                                                                                               java.lang.String tweetTime,
                                                                                                                                               @RequestParam(value="imageUrl")
                                                                                                                                               java.lang.String imageUrl,
                                                                                                                                               @RequestParam(name="latitude",defaultValue="0.0")
                                                                                                                                               float latitude,
                                                                                                                                               @RequestParam(name="longitude",defaultValue="0.0")
                                                                                                                                               float longitude)
        A HTTP POST request handler, responsible for serving /tweets/add/$groupid. This method gets POSTed as the Tweet-creation form with prefilled group is submitted. All input-field values are passed as parameters and checked for validity. Upon success a new Tweet is added to the prefilled group in the database.
        Parameters:
        groupID - POST param bearing the referenced input-field value
        content - POST param bearing the referenced input-field value
        tweetDate - POST param bearing the referenced input-field value
        tweetTime - POST param bearing the referenced input-field value
        imageUrl - POST param bearing the referenced input-field value
        latitude - POST param bearing the referenced input-field value
        longitude - POST param bearing the referenced input-field value
        Returns:
        Redirect-view if successful, else error-view

      • editTweet

        @RequestMapping(value="/edit/{tweetID}")
public org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView editTweet(@PathVariable
                                                                                                        int tweetID)
        A HTTP GET request handler, responsible for serving /tweets/edit/$tweetid. This method is responsible to present the Tweet-creation form with the group and date prefilled into the according input-field. As such the form is re- used to edit a already created Tweet.
        Parameters:
        tweetID - Path param containing an ID-reference to a Tweet
        Returns:
        View containing the Tweet-creation form with prefilled group and date

      • editTweetPost

        @RequestMapping(value="/edit/{tweetID}",
                method=POST)
public org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView editTweetPost(@PathVariable
                                                                                                                                          int tweetID,
                                                                                                                                          @RequestParam(value="content")
                                                                                                                                          java.lang.String content,
                                                                                                                                          @RequestParam(value="imageUrl")
                                                                                                                                          java.lang.String imageUrl,
                                                                                                                                          @RequestParam(name="latitude",defaultValue="0.0")
                                                                                                                                          float latitude,
                                                                                                                                          @RequestParam(name="longitude",defaultValue="0.0")
                                                                                                                                          float longitude)
        A HTTP POST request handler, responsible for serving /tweets/edit/$tweetid. This method gets POSTed as the Tweet-editing form is submitted. All input- field values are passed as parameters and checked for validity. Upon success the referenced Tweet gets updated in the database or an error is shown.
        Parameters:
        tweetID - Path param containing an ID-reference to a Tweet
        content - POST param bearing the referenced input-field value
        imageUrl - POST param bearing the referenced input-field value
        latitude - POST param bearing the referenced input-field value
        longitude - POST param bearing the referenced input-field value
        Returns:
        Redirect-view if successful, else error-view

      • deleteTweet

        @RequestMapping(value="/delete/{tweetID}")
public org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView deleteTweet(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                                                                                            @PathVariable
                                                                                                            int tweetID)
        A HTTP GET request handler, responsible for serving /tweets/delete/$tweetid. This method presents the user with a confirmation dialog, before forwading to the actual deletion the the referenced Tweet.
        Parameters:
        request - Autowired HttpServletRequest object, containing header-fields
        tweetID - Path param containing an ID-reference to a Tweet
        Returns:
        View containing confirmation dialog for the intended action

      • confirmedDeleteTweet

        @RequestMapping(value="/delete/{tweetID}/confirm")
public java.lang.String confirmedDeleteTweet(@PathVariable
                                                                                                 int tweetID,
                                                                                                 @RequestParam(name="referer",defaultValue="")
                                                                                                 java.lang.String referer)
        A HTTP GET request handler, responsible for serving /tweets/delete/$tweetid/confirm. This method triggers the actual deletion the the referenced Tweet and redirects to a referer, if applicable.
        Parameters:
        tweetID - Path param containing an ID-reference to a Tweet
        referer - Request param containing the referer to redirect to
        Returns:
        Redirect-view
